revised_title: Magnetic Inclination, Force, and Declination in the Caribee Islands, West Indies
tldr: This article presents the results of magnetic measurements taken in the Caribee Islands, West Indies, in August 1886. The author, T. E. Thorpe, provides detailed observations of magnetic inclination, force, and declination at various locations, including St. George, Grenada, Hog Island, and the Island of Carriacou. The data collected may have been affected by local disturbances and volcanic activity in the region.
